website_summaries.verdict: Numerous sensors and programs allow users to analyze basic atmospheric data like the pros.
pros: WiFi delivers outdoor readings to indoor base
Sensors measure a wide range of data
cons: some data is hard to read

customer_reviews.title: Two of four devices failed within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a few months, then the main unit failed completely. Disassembled and reseated everything and it started working. A month later one of the three remotes will no longer communicate at all (though it shows temps; new batteries in all did not help). Even from the beginning the communication was very spotty, a location that worked perfectly for days would just stop. I could deal with that, but now 2 of 4 devices failing is just ridiculous. It's a shame as it is a nice setup and design.
customer_reviews.author: Linwood

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work 10ft away!
customer_reviews.text: Signal wont travel even 5 feet through the thin metal wall of a mobile home. Wont travel 10ft from crawlspace to upstairs. Its usless! I can maybe understand the metal siding, it doesnt even register a reading on the base station. but the thermometer in my crawl space reads 58° yet the base station just 10ft away ..with No metal between them.. does give a reading yet it says its 76°!?! Go Figure! The kicker is i was given less than 30days to return it so now im stuck with it! P. O. S!
customer_reviews.author: James Rousey

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you need warranty service
customer_reviews.text: Product has a faulty remote sensor that displays "hh.h" for the temperature. Ambient said will not honor their warranty on the item because I purchased it from someone else on Amazon. That's pretty bad.
customer_reviews.author: my reviews

customer_reviews.title: Suitably Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: 3 sensor transmitters, 1 foot apart each, same room, nearly 10% difference among them for humidity and 5% difference for temperature. The base unit also exaggerates temperature and humidity. This product is a great idea but cheaply made. Edit: After giving it 24 hours temps are within 1 degree and humidity is within 1%! This product is the most accurate wireless temperature and humidity package I’ve ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works OK when it works.
customer_reviews.text: My first unit worked well for a couple years, then one sensor stoped working. Anticipatin future sensor problems, I ordered another complete(base plus 3 sensor) package. Tried new sensor, which worked but did not transmit to base.Installed new base and all three sensors were transmitting, but in Celsius, even though they were set for Fahrenheit(and showed on the sensor display Fahrenheit). Too late to return sec and unit, as I's had it too l one. Does anyone have a suggestion to make this unit function properly, or, referable, a more reliable unit to buy and start anew?
customer_reviews.author: Richard Besser

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Been using for several months to monitor temperature of my covered porch, attic, garage, and of course the inside. None of my sensors are more than 30' straight line away from the base station and they have all worked flawlessly. The max and min tracking is an excellent feature as well. Have not yet used the alarm. Also have not had any problems with dead batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for me....
customer_reviews.text: The unit is easy to read etc. but it does have a couple of glitches that aren't "serious"... You set Celsius vs. Fahrenheit readings via dip switch settings on the remote sensor yet for whatever reasons sometimes the base reads differently? Don't know why but when that happens, I just pull batteries on the base and it re-sets to what I set in the remote unit. Seems to occur when re-setting the min/max. And speaking of the Min/Max reset.. you have to sort of pay attention. You have to re-set separately both the min and the max for each channel. Not a big deal but different than what I've been used to. All in all I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied, better than the Acu-Link
customer_reviews.text: This thing is wonderful! I love the read outs on the sensors. The alarms are nice. It's super easy to dial in your desired alarms for both humidity and temperature. It's very responsive and doesn't take long to send updated info to the receiver. I returned the Acu-Link Wi-Fi after it simply wouldn't update fast enough. The app didn't work consistently and errored out a majority of the time. I really liked the concept of the Acu-Link, but it doesn't matter how many bells and whistles you have if the core system doesn't work. This was half the price, and as long as I use something slick like Alfred, I can check temps while on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and long distance readings are good
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have is the one outside. They all are very accurate (within 2 degrees and two % on humidity) with the exception on the one outside. I’m thinking if I put it on a post with a cover over the top, I will get a accurate reading. The one in the shop is accurate, the house is accurate, the one in the generator box is accurate. So far very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Worked will for almost a year then one unit stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked will for almost a year then one unit stopped communicating with the base unit, changed batteries in both, still no go. Now it has stopped communicating with the other two. The remote units still work just won't communicate anymore with the base unit.
customer_reviews.author: John, Oregon

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I had this unit for less than a year and all three sensors gave me an HH.H error, meaning replace the sensor. Less than a year and nothing works except the main unit. NOT going to buy any replacement sensors. These were all in the house, never exposed to outside weather. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use this in a camper to make sure storage and water bays aren’t freezing. Works great with 3 sensors. Transmits through aluminum and fiberglass fine. Farthest sensor is abou 16ft away from station inside aluminum toolbox and station receives signal. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Charles F. Meiklejohn

customer_reviews.title: I know it is getting really good reviews here but mine is turning out to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I know it is getting really good reviews here but mine is turning out to be very unreliable, and will not pick up sensors in RV storage bins or the readings show up only sometimes. I am looking for one that always works good.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Liked it but....
customer_reviews.text: Calibration is done with an offset on the main unit. Units do not agree what the temp is in the same location differing by as much as 5 degrees. Batteries only last a few months. Display, tracking, and alarm options are limited. No names for locations of sensors. User interface is complicated and requires referral to instructions each time changes are made.
customer_reviews.author: Saejin

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but the sensor range is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: As long as the sensors are close enough to the base unit, it works great. I live in a small 2 bedroom apartment so the sensors aren't very far away but I still ran into range issues. Walls do play an issue in the range the sensors can reach but personally I think the range should be a lot better than what it is. I had to put the main unit right outside of the 2 bedrooms I wanted to use it in and the 3rd sensor is outside a window real close to the main unit. Even moving the main unit to a different wall 5 feet away caused me to lose connection with one of the bedroom sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Burton

customer_reviews.title: A decent unit to monitor 4 temperatures at once.
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of 3 of the remotes are working properly with about a 30 foot range (one is outdoors, and one is in the attic), and the third one only had about a 15 foot range. Surprisingly, I put it inside a freezer about 10 feet away and it's been working perfectly. Go figure. I only needed 3 remotes and the indoor temperature displaying at once, so I did not run into the problem that you can only display a total of 4 thermometers at once. Also - and this is really limiting - the first three displays must be thermometers set to frequency 1, 2, and 3...so you can't buy two sets and monitor 8 different temperatures at once.
customer_reviews.author: MightyFavog

customer_reviews.title: I have these in several rooms in my house including ...
customer_reviews.text: I have these in several rooms in my house including upstairs and the main unit shows a constant updated display. Just closing the door can make a big difference, especially during the winter. As I recall it was at least 20 degrees colder, just on the other side of the door. If there's a really cold spell, then I might try some additional insulation and see the effect with these thermometers. Haven't had to change a battery yet, so apparently not an energy hog.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Lancelot

customer_reviews.title: I like the --one view see all 4 temps @ all ...
customer_reviews.text: Put 3 inside and one outside ---- started out having all 3 near to each other --- all 3 were very, very close to each other in numbers---, bought another set - different company - and these 3 were consistently very near the same -- sent the other set back and kept this one, I like the --one view see all 4 temps @ all time!!! NO flashy colors or other goofy symbols and pictures -- temperatures and humidities too.
customer_reviews.author: steel4real1

customer_reviews.title: Seemed at first ok ..... but Update humidity is WAY off
customer_reviews.text: Seem to work well still testing but .... calibration does seem to drift UPDATE well a little off okay BUT the humidity is way off I HAVE ONE AT 10% AND ANOTHER AT 95% IN THE SAME LOCATION NOW. Originally they were kind of close but NOW one is 95% and another is 10% in the SAME location. This is the reading at the sensor and on the remote. There seem to be no way to calibrate. My reading for my records history are all shot now.
customer_reviews.author: Ken from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because I needed three separate sensors one didn't work company didn't send a new one. Amazon took it off my bill. Purchased one with three sensors that worked from a different company. Just don't understand some of these companies.
customer_reviews.author: BBhBhfBhfsBhfsfBhfsfgBhfsfgjBhfsfgjfBhfsfgjfdBhfsfgjfdv

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, good price
customer_reviews.text: The three-sensor unit worked exactly as advertised. Setup is a little fiddly, messing with dip switches (hello, it's 2018) but not hard to figure out. We've had it a couple months and had to re-set one of the units, but that was easy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Luoma

customer_reviews.title: Best buy weve ever made
customer_reviews.text: Best investment for our rv . We placed one in storage, one in underbelly, one outside on stepladder, and the monitor measures indoors. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Genger Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Temp readings are slightly suspect but without anything to compare them to...
customer_reviews.text: Probably because one is in a corner between sun and shade it reads more based on the sun hitting it other than the air temp, otherwise the device itself is genius and the indoor temp matched my thermometer on the base and the three units.
customer_reviews.author: Seven Toe Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Could be a great unit if they would update the programming.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a week to monitor multiple fridge and freezer temperatures. The unit works well but I haven't tested it's range over ~15ft. I had planned to buy an additional unit to have 3 more channels and a second screen to display channels 4-6 but the display is hard programmed to always show 1-3 and makes reading additional channels at a glance very inconvenient. Channels 4-8 can only be viewed on the bottom line.
customer_reviews.author: MitsuKev

customer_reviews.title: junk after 3 months totally failed never gave the correct
customer_reviews.text: junk after 3 months totally failed never gave the correct temp
customer_reviews.author: lonny j. breaux

customer_reviews.title: Actually work. Which is often a surprise for these types of remote thermometers.
customer_reviews.text: I first calibrated these units by parking all of them next to our thermostat and made the happy discovery that they were all within a degree of each other. The I dispersed them across a two-story house and on an external pillar and made the equally happy discovery that they all managed to communicate with the base station. So I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lackland

customer_reviews.title: These work great. I can monitor several areas of the home ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to monitor humidity levels in our home after we had to have some mold remediation. These work great. I can monitor several areas of the home from one location. I can't comment on the accuracy as I have another weather monitor with a built in humidity level and they differ by 1-2%. Not a big deal and I am not sure which is wrong (or both) but if it's accurate to 3% I am fine with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but slow in response
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality product. My only complaint is it is slow to register the accurate temperature. I used the remotes to monitor the temperature in the refrigerator, freezer, and cooler during a power outage. Took forever to get to the appropriate range.
customer_reviews.author: John Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected,
customer_reviews.text: I have used numerous remote sensors over the years, and this unit is the best one to date. Range is about Average, this unit is susceptible to rf interference. Locate it away from other devices, such as tvs, radios and other types of wireless security systems. Occasionally will lose a signal, but recovers it within a few minutes. We use it to monitor crawlspace humidity, greenhouse and a freezer out in a detached garage.
customer_reviews.author: bugeyebandit

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your outside temps (and maybe your batteries?)
customer_reviews.text: This seems okay for warmer climates, I purchased it to use as a fridge/freezer remote thermometer, and it works fine for the units in the fridge (above freezing), but the freezer unit simply dies. It may just be that batteries don't work in sub freezing temps, but there are other battery powered thermometers that seem okay at lower temps. It isn't the problem of a signal making it out of the fridge either, the remote sensor simply shuts itself off below about 25 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gray

customer_reviews.title: The temperature readings seem accurate and the wireless range is ...
customer_reviews.text: The temperature readings seem accurate and the wireless range is about 20-30 feet. But the humidity measurement method must be a roll of the dice. The indoor reading seems accurate but if its cold outside, my units say its 70% humidity. Hardly possible in the arid, winter climate of Alaska.
customer_reviews.author: AK Retired

customer_reviews.title: finecky but nice.
customer_reviews.text: I had a heck of a time getting the last sensor to communicate with the base station. I removed/reinstalled batteries, switched channels, nothing worked. I gave up on it, then one day it just started communicating on it's own, about 2 weeks after I got it. All stations appear to be reporting accurately. Each sensor has a small display, as well as sending the info to the base station.There is a small hole on the back of each sensor so that you can hang it from a screw or nail.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeee2002

customer_reviews.title: No back lighting, but good unit otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and was easy to setup - all the remotes were pre-configured. Unfortunately, there is no way to turn off alarms on when it gets too cold or too warm. Since I am not using this feature, I had to set it to levels I'm hoping never to see. Also, no back lighting makes it hard to use in the dark. I'm using it to monitor the conditions in kids rooms and all the units are pretty close to the base - so far, no issues with interference though.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in The longevity of this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in The longevity of this product. We purchased in December, 2015 and from May, 2018 to date it works sporadically. All batteries replaced and contacts cleaned. Currently none of the stations are working.
customer_reviews.author: Orchard view

customer_reviews.title: Sensor short circuit, overheating in less than 30 days
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the ambient weather station for a couple of weeks. This morning, one of the sensors was reading 100degF in my daughter’s room that was less than 70degF. Went to check on the sensor and found it very hot to the touch. The battery low warning was showing on the display. Replaced the batteries with new and the sensor starting heating up immediately. Sensor has an internal short circuit. Worried about possible safety risk with this product. Not worth the risk to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to scan the temperature all at once for my two floor apartment: downstairs in the living room, outside my window, upstairs in my two bedrooms. I also like being able to adjust the temperature readings that they are all based on the same relative standard: I use my living room. Without adjusting the four temperature readings, they are about 1 to 1.5 degrees different when all four gauges are in the same room, at the same height, about three feet from each other.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: Good design and works, mostly.
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and it works, mostly. I say mostly because one of the three sensors won't synch with the main unit no matter where I place it. I tried reassigning the channel numbers, but this one sensor just won't synch. Unfortunately, I spent too long trying to get it to work, and now I've missed the return deadline. Replacement sensor is nearly twenty dollars with shipping! So my advice is get it, but test thoroughly in the first week and complain about any nonfunctional sensors quickly.
customer_reviews.author: bw

customer_reviews.title: Good product although the display should be better
customer_reviews.text: Superior to many models since the outdoor sensors are sealed to keep out water. Also, unlike some other models, batteries from all units do not have to be removed and replaced if the signal is lost from one of the transmitters. This replaced a 15-year-old weather station that finally failed; it was superior in one regard, which is that the display was easier to read from almost any angle.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great weather station
customer_reviews.text: I've had the unit for approximately a month now with no problems. I've left my single unit of another brand outside along side this unit to compare accuracy and they are very close or the same at any given time. The 3 sensors are anywhere from 20 feet away to 60 feet away from the base unit and all work well. I am very pleased with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: The main unit and the satellite units are accurate. I compared them with other thermometers. It could be better if they had a light screen option.
customer_reviews.author: trzgl

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable
customer_reviews.text: This product has some nice features but is relatively unreliable at a distance. Several of my remote detectors would connect but would periodically drop out. I also had some problems with the alarms not going off when they should have but was never able to trace the problem. I have stopped using the system except for using the remotes as a thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph F.

customer_reviews.title: Screen died after 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Has the ability to be calibrated, very cool for this type product. To bad they didn’t put the effort into keeping the screen working. I’ve owned lots of these gadgets, this 1 lasted less than 10 minutes before the screen went blank. At least the remote units display info. I’m embarrassed that people were at risk (covid19) to deliver this. I won’t endanger anyone else for a return. Just another jewel from China they could have kept.
customer_reviews.author: joshua smith

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: Works well when it works. I have had this for 3 months and the batteries have died twice already. It looses the signals every few days and you need to try and reset it to find all of the signals again. I have it on my first floor with several above and one on the floor below. Loved the concept of this just wish it helps on to the signal and didn't eat the batteries as much
customer_reviews.author: Lax

customer_reviews.title: Works great, accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Have a sensor in my attic (recently installed an exhaust fan and wanted to see if it's working, kicking on at the right temp, pulling out hot air, etc). One outside and one in my workshop. The digital displays on the sensors are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to monitor my freezers x2 and my milk refrigerator. I raise my own beef, poultry, and pork and have my own milk cow, so I maintain an inventory of $1000+ of product and this give me peace of mind that I’ll receive an early warning if a unit stops working.
customer_reviews.author: M2

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Buttons on the mother station didn't work well, and it was hard to click. After a couple of months two of three sensors lost their accuracy completely. The humidity on one of them was reporting 10-25% all the time, even though it was over 80% at night; the second one reported temperature a degree or two higher than other ALL THE TIME when I placed all three together. The third one worked most of the time, but once in a while reported 1% humidity for a short period of time. A good concept, but it is garbage if the numbers they reported cannot be replied upon.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Did a good job for 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly at advertised. I have the main unit upstairs, one just outside under my heat pump, one in the basement beneath me and one about 30 feet away in my wifes office through 3 walls. All get signal and work just fine. It worked fine through 3 winters and 3 summers. The three sensors all stopped working recently. It's good for a little while but it isn't built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jaric Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: If something is between the remote sensor and the base station then it's even worse. On the bright side it does seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't even come close to 100' let alone the claimed 300 and that's line of site. If something is between the remote sensor and the base station then it's even worse. On the bright side it does seem to be fairly accurate.
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold max/min values properly
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, disappointed in this product. Calibration is iffy at best and walks. I can get over the degree or two and the +-1 to 3 % humidity. What I bought this for was to keep an accurate record of the current and max/min temp in 4 rooms. This device has had issues with keeping max/min temp and humidity since day 1. After reseting max/min every time the max jumps to 140 degrees. If you're looking for a multi room temp monitor for your server room look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Shelley Yukon

customer_reviews.title: Returned this product. It seems very generic for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned this product. It seems very generic for the price. The values, temp/humidty, didn't register the same on all remote transmitters even though they were sitting on the table next to each other. I waited two hours for them to self calibrate and still registered differently. Not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Still going strong even after a year. Even the one outside is good to go. Seems to be accurate. I checked with another thermostat and humid stat and they were all within range of each other.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Miller

customer_reviews.title: Range is NOT accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this higher stars but can't. I have a cinder block house that does have rebar in the construction. The range for the remote senders is less than 30 feet. Not the 300 and 100 (?) claimed. If I move the sensor closer, it will no longer be outside. I will keep the unit as it offers features I do like. Will use two sensors instead of more😢. Wish I knew this before buying extra sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work perfectly. Exact temp as adjacent thermometers. Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Akfireftr

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: The system and went a full 2 years before I needed to replace the batteries. My only issue is figuring out how to set the channels after I replaced the batteries. What was #1 is now somehow #3. Oh well. Still definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Leon R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for RVs!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We use this in our RV (travel trailer). Wintering in cold weather can be a little tricky at times in an RV. We ordered this and have two sensors underneath the RV (one at each end), and one outside. Gives us piece of mind that our pipes won't freeze. It's great! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GREAT. perfect for a 2 story house. WORKS awesome for us to help us regulate our nursery
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this unit for 6 months, and its information is accurate, the battery lives of all senders and receiver steady, and is easy to use. This is my first unit which displays humidity, and it is invaluable for reporting outside as well as greenhouse humidities. Its display is large and easy to see, especially at eye level. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A guy's perspective

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Base unit is quite inaccurate (5* from ambient). Remote units are all inconsistent with base unit and each other. Literally three degrees from each other. Technically the remotes can be "calibrated," but not really, the remote displays will always show the uncalibrated temperature and base unit is not able to be calibrated. Hygrometer features are horrendously inaccurate, but that is not uncommon for devices like this, still they are 10s of % points off from each other. I would not buy this again. I wish I had kept the packaging so I can return such an inaccurate device.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good until the thermometers fail
customer_reviews.text: The unit was working well for ~12 months. Now all of a sudden one of the thermometers gives a reading of <15% RH (whereas I know it should be 60%+). Somethings broken with the unit and I'm not sure how, or if it can be fixed. Trying to follow-up with Ambient Weather on this but no response yet.
customer_reviews.author: retro_r

customer_reviews.title: works perfect. I have other temp/humidity gauges in the same ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this set up for 2 days now, works perfect. I have other temp/humidity gauges in the same rooms/areas the wireless probes are & its all accurate. I have a 3 story big house & the one probe is in the basement & the LCD screen is on the top floor so I can monitor my garden from far away. Perfect piece of gardening equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster39

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, I use it in my motorhome to monitor ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, I use it in my motorhome to monitor the freezer and fridge while we are traveling (bought 2 additional senders with temp probes). I also use one of the others 3 in an outside bay to see outside temps and then one other in one of the bay compartments for temps in the bays under the motorhome. I would recommend and buy this product again...
customer_reviews.author: T. G.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. When I set it up and put all ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. When I set it up and put all of the recivers in the same place the temprature range was just under 1 degree F. amd humidity varied by only 1%. I' ve got one unit in my fridge to replace a broken fridge unit, and it's sending a signal just fine. Likeiwse for the one strapped under my RV.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H. Byerly

customer_reviews.title: Remote Freezer Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a remote freezer monitor. One sensor is inside the freezer and usually is able to transmit a signal 40' - 50' inside to the receiver/display. Sometimes it can't 'make it outside the box' but usually it does and lets me see how cold it is inside. The other senders are used to check the temperature and humidity in the garage and also the crawl space under the house. I'm happy with this device and may even add additional senders as it can monitor up to 8 areas.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product for anyone looking for multiple remote units
customer_reviews.text: Great product for anyone looking for multiple remote units. Placement of the remotes is critical to get accurate readings. No calibration was required. Only con is the display. The numbers are very small compared to other units and you have to get within a few feet of the unit to read it. If you need to read it from across the room, this is not the unit for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! But...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! But one of the remote sensors failed, as noted in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier: it was easy to set up (including the ...
customer_reviews.text: In spite of reading reviews from dissatisfied buyers, I went ahead and purchased this product. Couldn't be happier: it was easy to set up (including the fact that the three transmitters were already set to be units 1/2/3, all four readings were very close to each up during the set up, and I've had no problems at all. Only had it for a week now, but I'm happy. Did have to find ten AAA batteries though.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in an 18502' house, I can verify each upstairs rooms temp/humidity
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, is Really accurate, & easy to set up. Works great in an 18502 house I can verify each upstairs room temp/humidity...
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: One of our family members has this for their children’s rooms and we got it on their recommendation for our baby. We like the alarm feature as peace of mind at night
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It is so nice to see it all in one glance
customer_reviews.text: I got this to monitor both the outside temperature and the those of the living room and the 2 bedrooms to ensure that the cold winter weather outside was not unduly affecting each of these rooms. It is so nice to see it all in one glance. I did put a lithium battery in the the remote of the outside to handle the sub-zero temperatures. The whole setup has been working very well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Being a weather geek, I have owned a few different wireless thermometers. This one works well and seems fairly accurate. Follow the instructions and set up is a breeze. I had to re-calibrate all of the remote sensors slightly, which is also very simple if you follow instructions. In all if your looking for a unit with multiple temp/ humidity sensors around your home, this is a great unit for the price. Would highly recommend. Joe E G
customer_reviews.author: Joe E G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Big numbers and easy to operate. I like the max/min button to check highs and lows.
customer_reviews.author: kgb

customer_reviews.title: Ballpark Measurements
customer_reviews.text: If accuracy isn't important, ballpark measurements are OK then it;s OK for you. Both temperature & humidity are always off a great deal
customer_reviews.author: DLJunkie

customer_reviews.title: ... of use to date it appears to be a great product. As some of the reviews prior to ...
customer_reviews.text: For the few weeks of use to date it appears to be a great product. As some of the reviews prior to purchase stated the probes may stop working. This happened to one of the probes on the second day of use but not since. Our solution was to "reboot". The battery was remove for a moment on the individual probe only. Works great now.
customer_reviews.author: ProPilot

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, channel 2 sensor partially failed after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my RV. After a few months of use channel 2 (which we used for the refrigerator) wouldn't read accurately below 60 degrees. Channel 3 is in the freezer and works great. Channel 4 is now in the 'Frig and 2 is outside. My buy another sensor to replace 2.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good unit that has been in operation now about a ...
customer_reviews.text: When I got the unit and the remotes I experimented with where to place the home unit. I placed several in places around the house, including one 2 feet outside under ground to track ground temperature. The main unit is about 10 feet inside the garage from it and about 50 feet from the others. All read perfectly, This is a very good unit that has been in operation now about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Crispin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for monitoring with alarming
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my multiple area monitoring needs. I'm using them to monitor and alarm for my refrigerator, outside, garden, cat shelter, and garage temps. I love the ability to expand up to 8 channels and set alarms as needed if you don't want your garden to be exposed to frost.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Have sensors placed upstairs, downstairs, and outside. Signal from the sensors seem very good since I have not yet seen the display missing any readings. Had it for ~a year already, and had to replace the batteries in the main unit once just about a month ago. Two of the sensors are showing low battery but are still working.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a weather fan, so I gave him this thermometer system for Christmas. He enjoys seeing the temperature variations both inside and outside the house. One of the remote units will, periodically, go off line, however. It is not a battery issue. No rhyme or reason to it. It goes, and then it comes back, mysteriously. Hence, four stars, rather than five.
customer_reviews.author: BMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Love knowing the temps.
customer_reviews.text: Really like having the extra monitors. One for outside, one for the bedroom (because we like to keep it cooler there than the rest of the house), and one for the garage (since it is not insulated, curious as to how efficient or inefficient or heating/cooling system is), and of course it is located in our main living area so it's quite convenient to see at any time.
customer_reviews.author: hondamanda

customer_reviews.title: If only it could tell time
customer_reviews.text: I use this to monitor different areas in, under, and outside my RV. It works pretty good for this purpose. One of the remote units has very limited range and the reading is intermittent at best. This was a replacement remote after I crushed one of the originals. I keep looking at the unit to check the time, but there's no clock in this one.
customer_reviews.author: ConstantCritic

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I can not recommend, the base station came defective will not synch with remote sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Fuller

customer_reviews.title: They are a joke for outside temps in the winter ...
customer_reviews.text: They are a joke for outside temps in the winter time. Under normal conditions they are off by about 2 degrees. When the temps drop below freezing they are off from 5 to 9 degrees. The colder it gets the more they are off. I tested these using highly accurate medical laboratory thermometers. I switched them around, changed batteries, etc, and the same result. I would not buy any Ambient weather instrument, based on the performance of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Barry W. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Compared to others I have tried this is perfect to me
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box and accurate. All channels within 2% and 2 degrees. Compared to others I have tried this is perfect to me. I haven't been able to find a hygrometer that was accurate yet and I have even tried the Caliber III and IV
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline H. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get the calibration correct between units. don't expect to use it out of the box and get equal readings at same spot. I did not try to calibrate it to NWS for humidity. I have a home with high vaulted ceilings and these are used to alert me when temp or humidity gets out of reason in a particular room.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Juy 25 and it died a sudden death yesterday - September 25. So, it worked reasonably well (subject to intermittant dropouts as noted in other reviews) for two months. I can not find any warranty info in this. Not a reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Michelangelo's happy, I'm happy!
customer_reviews.text: As I was setting up the dog house for my tortoise, I found I needed a way to reliably monitor the temperature so I knew he had a proper warm and cool spot for him to hang out. So I put one sensor under the heating lamp and one in his cool corner and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Now
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. I calibrated the senders and found them to be less than 1% off. I have an Acu-rite that is off by 7%. The senders are mounted in the crawl space and there is no problem with receiving the signal in the house.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: then this is a good unit.
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the 300' of transmission distance is a pipe dream...even glass seems to be a major inhibitor. I'm going to look for something with more powerful transmitters, as I need more distance. If you can life with 50-100' of transmission distance, then this is a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: mzimmers

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor sensor disconnects as soon as I move it from ...
customer_reviews.text: Outdoor sensor disconnects as soon as I move it from inside next to the receiver to 15 feet away outside...one wall in between. I'm getting ready to return this. I bought lithium ion batteries...still can't pick up one 15 feet with one wall in between.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Leischer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year, then broke. Changed batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about a year, then broke. Changed batteries on all 4 pieces, did not help. No temp or humidity numbers come up on main screen.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Good temp/hygro unit
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this temp/hygrometer. The readings are accurate and update often. My only issue was getting channels 2 and 4 to display properly, the channels were set according to direction but seemed to both show up as channel 2. Luckily I just had to pull the battery and reset and they now work great.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Ambient Weather WS-10 Wireless Hygrometer to measure temperature/humidity levels in my house crawlspace. The key was to be able to observe levels at various locations in the space from within the house/living area. Directions were easy to follow and set-up was straight forward. Both the console and remote sensors calibrated well out of the box against a test hygrometer. Despite several obstructions in the crawlspace (i.e. flexible ducts, PVC piping, etc,), the sensors work great and no transmission interference to the console has occurred. I am very pleased with the product to this point (about two weeks in use) and would highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Thermometers fail after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: After a few months, the thermometers start to fail, one by one (including the main console). Temperatures begin to read randomly10-30 degrees above actual which also throws off the humidity calculation. Removing batteries and restarting doesn't help, nor does new batteries. I have two of these sets, and the same thing happened with each one.
customer_reviews.author: Dubaigary

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this unit. I have a home with three levels and this allows me to see the temp on all three plus outside. Had a unit before where I had to press buttons to see different areas and this is by far more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Chill2345

customer_reviews.title: The range on this thing is terrible. Only 1 out of 3 updates unless I ...
customer_reviews.text: The range on this thing is terrible. Only 1 out of 3 updates unless I get within 25 ft of the other 2. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Gstel

customer_reviews.title: Works like advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is great with multiple greenhouses I can tell exactly where I am on temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T.

customer_reviews.title: Great temp reading for different locations
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Sensors have slightly different readings but you can adjust these on the monitor, so that's an easy fix. Needs a total of 10 AAA batteries, not included. Batteries should last for about 12 months according to the manual, but we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: The Best Hygrometer in the market.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, effective, it does what is supposed to do. I have one of each detectors inside of the cases of my acoustic guitars, in order to keep between 45% to 55% of Relative Humidity. Big display, with big numbers and precise measurement of the three detectors. I tested them for accuracy, and they are perfectly calibrated. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dust Roger

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described. Numbers are easy to read from a distance. and individual sensors work well. Very happy with purchase. Also, it is easy to set-up high and low alarms. Main units requires four AAA batteries, and each sensor requires two AA batteries each. Update: I just purchased a second one for my dad.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Rajca

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these. They don't come close to the range that they claim. I had a different one for a long time and it it works well in the same location as I tried this product, but the new ones just don't work.
customer_reviews.author: JR

product_meta.title: Ambient Weather WS-10 Wireless Indoor/Outdoor 8-Channel Thermo-Hygrometer with Three Remote Sensors
product_meta.description:
Additional Features: 
The scroll mode allows you to view the indoor thermometer/hygrometer and remote channels without pressing any buttons. In scroll mode, all of the indoor and detected outdoor sensors will be displayed in five second intervals. 

Each remote sensor includes dip switches for channel selection and units of measure (degF vs degC). 

The sensor search mode allows you to re-sync sensors without removing and re-inserting batteries. 

Features: 
Indoor/Outdoor temperature & humidity 
Outdoor temperature range: lithium batteries: -40°F to 140°F 
Outdoor temperature range: non-lithium batteries: -4°F to 140°F 
Indoor/Outdoor Humidity range 10% to 99% 
Rate of change indicators 
Scroll mode automatically displays each sensor every 5 seconds 
Dip switch selectable remote channels 
Re-sync mode if sensor reception is interrupted 
Min/Max Memory for indoor/outdoor temperature & humidity 
Monitors temperature and humidity in up to 8 remote locations 
Includes three remote sensors (F007TH) - transmission range of up to 300 feet line of sight (100 feet under most conditions) 
Frequency: 433 MHz 
Update Rate: 60 seconds 
Console Dimensions (LxHxW): 4.50 x 5.0 x 1.00 in 
LCD Dimensions (LxW): 3.75 x 3.50" 
Power requirements: 
Main Unit - 4 x AAA (not included) 
Remote Sensor - 2 x AAA (not included)
feature_bullets: Simple to read, simple to use, and affordable, the WS-10 includes an indoor thermo-hygrometer and three remote thermometer/hygrometer sensors (F007TH), which can be read at the same time.
The display console can remotely read and update up to eight remote thermo-hygrometer sensors at the same.
The console includes audible and visual alarms when temperature and humidity exceed your pre-set minimum and maximum alarm settings.
The WS-10 includes three remote thermometer/hygrometers and five additional sensors can be added (F007TH, F007TP, F007T, F007PF) for comprehensive monitoring.
The console displays temperature and humidity, minimum and maximum temperature and humidity, which can be manually reset.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars924 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
